Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 10 for SLE 15 SP1)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 10 for SLE 15 SP1)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-197_37 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2020-1749: Fixed a vulnerability where in some cases IPv6 traffic would not be encrypted over an IPsec tunnel (bsc#1165629).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Live Patching 15 SP1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Live Patching 15 SP1

Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of some networking protocols in IPsec, such as VXLAN and GENEVE tunnels over IPv6. When an encrypted tunnel is created between two hosts, the kernel isn't correctly routing tunneled data over the encrypted link; rather sending the data unencrypted. This would allow anyone in between the two endpoints to read the traffic unencrypted. The main threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
